step_feedback.feedback: While you attempted to tighten your whole body during inhalation, the significant movement in your elbows and wrists suggests that you may not have engaged your core and larger muscle groups sufficiently. Focus on tightening your abdominal muscles and visualizing the fluid moving upwards towards your chest.

The hand placement on your abdomen is good. However, the inconsistent movement in your elbows and wrists across repetitions indicates that you need to maintain consistent muscle tension throughout the exercise. Try to coordinate your breathing with your muscle contractions more effectively.

In this step, you should be inhaling slowly through your nose while tightening your whole body muscles. The data shows inconsistent muscle engagement.  Try to visualize the fluid moving to your chest as you inhale.

Remember to exhale slowly through your mouth while relaxing your muscles.  The data suggests inconsistent relaxation and muscle release. Focus on completely relaxing your muscles as you exhale and visualize pushing the fluid out.

exercise_summary: You attempted the deep breathing exercise, but consistency in muscle engagement and relaxation needs improvement. Focus on coordinating your breathing with whole-body muscle tightening during inhalation and complete relaxation during exhalation.  Visualize the fluid movement to enhance the exercise's effectiveness.
